poem:
### Shadows at the Edge

In the heart's chapel,  
silence bruised,  
faith shudders—  
a bleak prayer  
caught in the throat  
of dawn.  
Behind stained glass,  
innocence flees;  
dark whispers  
sketch maps  
of despair.  
Yet in this  
ashen light,  
a simmering defiance,  
a hymn of togetherness  
rises, unbroken.
